de.mrapp.android.dialog

Class ProgressDialog.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mrapp.android.dialog.builder.AbstractMaterialDialogBuilder<DialogType,BuilderType>
      • de.mrapp.android.dialog.builder.AbstractHeaderDialogBuilder<DialogType,BuilderType>
        • de.mrapp.android.dialog.builder.AbstractValidateableDialogBuilder<DialogType,BuilderType>
          • de.mrapp.android.dialog.builder.AbstractButtonBarDialogBuilder<ProgressDialog,ProgressDialog.Builder>
            • de.mrapp.android.dialog.ProgressDialog.Builder
  • Enclosing class:
    ProgressDialog

    public static class ProgressDialog.Builder
extends AbstractButtonBarDialogBuilder<ProgressDialog,ProgressDialog.Builder>
    A builder, which allows to create and show dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and allow to indicate a running progress. Such a dialog consists of a title, a message and a circular progress bar. Optionally, up to three buttons can be shown.

      • Builder

        public Builder(@NonNull
               Context context,
               @StyleRes
               int themeResourceId)
        Creates a new builder, which allows to create dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and allow to indicate a running progress.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the builder, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        themeResourceId - The resource id of the theme, which should be used by the dialog, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid theme
